data.title: He's got a stammer
data.statement:
Everytime Marco tries to speak, he stammers.
If Marco has to say a text out loud, he will stammer on the first two letter of each word.

Here's the thing though, if he starts stammering, it will only get worse.
At first, he does not stammer.
Then, he stammers once.
When he's trying to say the nth word, he will stammer as many times as he did previously ((n-1)th word) plus as many times as he did even before that ((n-2)th word).

Example :
My name is Marco
My na-name is-is Ma-Ma-Marco

testCases.testIn: Hi there my name is Marco
testCases.testOut: Hi th-there my-my na-na-name is-is-is-is Ma-Ma-Ma-Ma-Ma-Marco

testCases.testIn: Im Marco its nice to see you there
testCases.testOut: Im Ma-Marco it-its ni-ni-nice to-to-to-to se-se-se-se-se-see yo-yo-yo-yo-yo-yo-yo-yo-you th-th-th-th-th-th-th-th-th-th-th-th-th-there

testCases.testIn: Do you know my brothers name is Polo
testCases.testOut: Do yo-you kn-know my-my-my br-br-br-brothers na-na-na-na-na-name is-is-is-is-is-is-is-is-is Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Po-Polo

data.inputDescription: The string [[S]] that marco is trying to say
data.outputDescription: [[M]] The sentence that Marco will end up saying

lastVersion.statementHTML:
The program:
Everytime Marco tries to speak, he stammers.
If Marco has to say a text out loud, he will stammer on the first two letter of each word.

Here's the thing though, if he starts stammering, it will only get worse.
At first, he does not stammer.
Then, he stammers once.
When he's trying to say the nth word, he will stammer as many times as he did previously ((n-1)th word) plus as many times as he did even before that ((n-2)th word).

Example :
My name is Marco
My na-name is-is Ma-Ma-Marco
INPUT:
The string S that marco is trying to say

OUTPUT:
M The sentence that Marco will end up saying

EXAMPLE:
Input
Hi
Output
Hi
